2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What role does the 2030 Climate Action Programme play in shaping sustainable mobility in Germany?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The 2030 Climate Action Programme is an important foundation for developing sustainable mobility in Germany. It contains key decisions for reducing CO2 emissions in the entire transport sector value chain, and is crucial for avoiding, relocating, and improving passenger and goods transport.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How can digitalization facilitate integrated, intermodal, and transregional mobility?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Digitalization enables the combination of existing and required components of sustainable mobility. It underlines opportunities in rail networks and technology, autonomous driving, and new mobility services. Passenger transport and logistics can be linked in a cost and time-efficient manner, and initiatives exist to advance the development of integrated, intermodal mobility platforms for planning, booking, and paying for journeys involving various transport providers.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What measures are being taken to make rail travel, cycling, and public transport more attractive alternatives to air travel, and how is the legal scope of local authorities regarding land management being affected?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The government is focusing on improving rail travel, expanding overnight rail services, and giving greater consideration to cycle traffic in the allocation of public space. In cooperation with the EU and municipal umbrella organizations, the legal scope of local authorities to manage and redistribute land is being broadened.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What measures is the German Government implementing as part of the 2030 Climate Action Programme, and what progress has been made on the development of charging infrastructure?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The German Government is implementing various measures under the 2030 Climate Action Programme, including the development of charging infrastructure for electric vehicles. In November 2019, a master plan for the development of charging infrastructure was approved.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What measures have been taken to expand charging infrastructure in Europe, and how much funding is involved?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Europe is installing an additional 50,000 public charging stations by the end of 2021, with a funding guideline of EUR 200 million for private charging infrastructure from November 2020 to December 2023. The public charging infrastructure programme is also being continued in the spring of 2021 with an additional budget of EUR 500 million.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the focus of the new 350 million grant programme for commercial charging infrastructure, and when is it expected to be launched?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The new grant programme focuses on charging stations for electric vehicles at workplaces, especially during working hours, and is expected to be launched in the spring of 2021. Additionally, the market launch is ongoing for renewable fuels, including electricity-based fuels from renewable energies and advanced biofuels, as part of the 2030 Climate Action Programme.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Which organizations are providing funding for Denmark's alternative fuel infrastructure development, and how much is being allocated?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Denmark will receive around EUR 1.54 billion from the European Investment Bank (EIB) and Danish Export Credit Agency (EKF) in the period from 2021 to 2024 for the development of infrastructure for alternative fuels, including electricity-based jet fuel, generating facilities for advanced biofuels, and other electricity-based renewable fuels.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What are some new initiatives included in the 2021 budget for rail research and sustainability in Germany?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The 2021 budget includes an additional EUR 7 million and commitment appropriations of EUR 10 million for rail research, specifically for the testing of digitally automated coupling and the digital test bed. There is also a new coordination unit set up to support climate-neutral initiatives. Additionally, mobility management is being introduced at supreme federal authorities, with practical recommendations outlined in the 2019 booklet "Mobilitatsmanagement in der Bundesverwaltung."

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What was published by the Federal Ministry of Transport and Digital Infrastructure on 23 April 2020, and how does it align with the 2030 Climate Action Programme?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The ministry published action guidelines for mobility management at federal authorities, which incorporate measures from the 2030 Climate Action Programme, including an amendment to federal travel expenses legislation that considers sustainability and environmental compatibility in addition to cost-effectiveness.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Which measures have been taken in recent times to promote sustainable mobility in Germany?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The use of rail travel for official trips is allowed even if it's more expensive than flying. A decree from January 2020 instructed authorities to prioritize purchasing low-emission official vehicles. Since early 2020, the Federal Ministry of Transport and Digital Infrastructure and the German Mobility Foundation have been supporting local government mobility projects with approximately €34 million through a research agenda. Around 50 local government projects have been funded to bring about a sustained change in the mobility sector with central stakeholders and multipliers from business, civil society, and science.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What were the topics discussed at the 13 July meeting?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The meeting discussed challenges of sustainable dietary habits and political measures for strengthening sustainable food systems. Additionally, 12 interdisciplinary research projects addressing mobility issues were mentioned.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What did the German government commit to regarding sustainable food systems in light of the pandemic and the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The German government expressed its commitment to creating sustainable food systems at the global, European, and national levels. It highlighted the importance of regional food production in Germany and throughout the world, as well as the social and political relevance of providing health-promoting, sustainably produced, and affordable foods. The government emphasized that safeguarding food supplies is a challenge of sustainable food systems throughout the entire value chain, from production and processing to trading, consumption, and disposal, and includes protecting environmental assets.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What were some key points discussed in relation to sustainable agriculture in the Farm-to-Fork Strategy of the European Union?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The Farm-to-Fork Strategy of the European Union emphasized creating more sustainable food systems at global and national levels. It welcomed the establishment of the Commission on the Future of Agriculture in Germany to facilitate sustainable agriculture. The public-sector mass catering facilities, particularly those of the federal administration, were stressed as role models for sustainable agriculture.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How is the Common Agricultural Policy (CAP) being updated to align with sustainability requirements and the European Green Deal?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The CAP is being updated for the period after 2020 to align with the goals of the European Green Deal, which includes a greater focus on environmental and climate action. At least 20% of food served at federal administration canteens must be organic. Germany, during its presidency of the EU, called for the CAP update to be brought into line with the Farm-to-Fork Strategy in the area of agriculture and diet. Other objectives of the CAP, such as security of supply, development of rural areas, competitiveness, income stability and risk hedging, also need to be considered for environmental, economic and social sustainability.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What role does the German public sector play in promoting organic food and new labels in public catering facilities?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The German public sector, through initiatives like "Bio Bitte - mehr Bio in offentlichen Kantinen" (More organic food in public canteens), plays a special role model function in promoting organic food and the introduction of new animal welfare and enhanced nutrition labels.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the goal of the Federal Scheme for Organic Farming and other Forms initiative in regards to organic food usage at public facilities?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The initiative aims to help decision-makers achieve a minimum of 20% organic food share at federal government's canteens, with practical guidance and support offered through a dialogue forum for stakeholders and decision-makers in the federal administration. An initial one-day forum is planned for autumn 2020. Additionally, an organic food installation was made by [in July 2020].

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What steps is the Commission taking to establish a new branch office and draw up recommendations for sustainable agriculture?

A final report is expected in the summer of 2021. Additionally, the Commission is strengthening its stance on deforestation-free supply chains for agricultural commodities, both domestically and internationally.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How does the company plan to contribute to the preservation of forests by promoting deforestation-free agricultural supply chains?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The company plans to make a recognizable contribution to the preservation of forests throughout the world by eliminating deforestation from the production and import of agricultural products, with particular attention paid to the protection and promotion of deforestation-free supply chains for agricultural commodities.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What role did the representatives of sustainability-related enterprise initiatives emphasize for businesses in ensuring sustainable development?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Businesses have a major responsibility in achieving long-term success by safeguarding social and environmental objectives, while also being innovative and competitive.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What did the representatives identify as necessary for climate neutrality and prosperity?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: They identified the need for an alliance of society, business, and government.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How does the European Green Deal factor into advancing climate protection and sustainability?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The European Green Deal is considered a unique opportunity to advance climate protection, sustainability, and the economy together.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What were the key themes discussed at the meeting regarding business sustainability?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The meeting acknowledged business successes and innovative solutions, but also called for further changes in internal and external orientation. The state was urged to create economically viable and reliable operating conditions, and social partners were encouraged to get involved. Corporate sustainability reporting was identified as an important lever for driving sustainable development.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What actions has the European Parliament taken regarding the review of the CSR Directive and non-financial reporting?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The European Parliament welcomed the review of Directive 2014/95/EU (CSR Directive) and drafted recommendations to strengthen non-financial reporting for the European Commission and European Economic and Social Committee. They also emphasized the importance of protecting primary forests and involving representatives of business, civil society, and science. The Parliament also referred to the decision of the German Federal Ministry of Finance to incorporate the German Sustainability Code into the principles of good corporate governance and active holdings management in the federal administration.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What are the expectations of the German government towards businesses regarding human rights due diligence?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The German government expects all businesses, regardless of size, sector, or position, to introduce a process of corporate human rights due diligence as set out in the National Action Plan on Business and Human Rights adopted in 2016.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How can public procurement promote sustainable and innovative products and services, contributing to sustainable economic recovery?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Public procurement agencies are encouraged to utilize the scope for sustainable procurement provided by public procurement legislation to promote sustainable and innovative products and services, making sustainable corporate actions more economically viable.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What steps is Germany taking to promote sustainable and innovative procurement at the EU level under its presidency, and how is implementation being achieved?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Germany's presidency has adopted initiatives to support sustainable and innovative procurement at the EU level. Implementation is being achieved through ministries engaging in discussions with businesses and business associations, as well as joint implementation initiatives with businesses to drive sustainable development, identify early action needs, and transfer knowledge.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Which discussion formats are used for business discussions in Germany, and how is the German government supporting companies in implementing sustainability practices?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The National CSR Forum, Stakeholder Roundtable on Sustainability, National Platform for Resource Efficiency, German Government's initiatives like EUREF and ZERO, and sector dialogues of the National Action Plan on Business and Human Rights are some discussion formats used for business discussions in Germany. The German government is further developing the www.csr-in-deutschland.de information portal in collaboration with other ministries to swiftly and needs-based refer companies to suitable advisory and support programs for sustainability and resource efficiency. The principle of the circular economy is a suitable concept for companies to contribute towards the transition to a climate-neutral and resource-efficient economy.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What was the focus of the State Secretaries' Meeting on sustainability in December 2020?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The meeting discussed the key role of education and commitment for sustainable development.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the significance of education and commitment in the context of sustainable development, according to?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Education and commitment are crucial for promoting sustainable development, as discussed at the State Secretaries' Meeting on sustainability in December 2020.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How does integrate sustainability aspects and indicators into its economic policy reporting?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The implementation of the SDGs and the targets of the Paris Agreement are fixed components of's economic policy reporting, with sustainability aspects and indicators communicated more strongly.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Why is education for sustainable development important for implementing the SDGs according to the meeting's resolution?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The resolution emphasized the major importance of SDG 4 "High-quality education," especially target 4.7 "Education for sustainable development," as a driver for implementing the SDGs. The objective of education for sustainable development is to enable people to understand the impact of their own actions on the world and make responsible, sustainable decisions. The meeting also confirmed support of the new ESD 2030 programme. Additionally, the meeting acknowledged the risks of the COVID-19 pandemic reinforcing existing inequalities and creating new ones.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Which stakeholders are important for promoting education for sustainable development (ESD) according to the State Secretaries?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The State Secretaries emphasized the importance of schools, universities, companies, sports clubs, local authorities, NGOs, and civil society, especially in the non-formal education sector, for further developing and expanding ESD. The commitment of young people, as demonstrated by movements like Fridays for Future, was also highlighted as crucial.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What are the key elements of the German Government's Youth Strategy for promoting active participation in civil society and education for sustainable development?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The German Government's Youth Strategy aims to inspire and enable as many young people as possible to participate actively in civil society. It includes creating scope for strengthening young people's engagement, international exchange through programs like international voluntary service and youth exchange schemes, and school twinning projects. Young people will also continue to shape the new ESD 2030 program nationally. Additionally, initial and further training for educational staff and managers is crucial for the success of education for sustainable development.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How is the implementation of the National Action Plan on Sustainability being strengthened and supplemented?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The participatory multi-stakeholder approach of the Federal Ministry for the Environment, Nature Conservation, Building and Nuclear Safety will continue to be used to implement the National Action Plan on Sustainability. New measures will be added, and their nationwide transfer will be supported via the National Platform on Education for Sustainable Development.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How can VETSD training and SISI initiative contribute to embedding sustainability in the education system and professional activity?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: VETSD training offers a platform where education, work, and profession meet, enabling the application of sustainability principles to professional activity and stimulating a sustainability-centric transformation in business and society. The SISI initiative links sustainability-oriented research with teaching to continue supporting the transfer between science and the world of work. Additionally, a new sustainability training office at BAkoV will develop a portfolio of courses for ministries and federal authorities to promote sustainability in governmental actions and achieve a climate-neutral administration by 2030.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the role of the Inter-Ministerial Committee in helping ministries further the implementation of the SDGs and the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The Inter-Ministerial Committee is a platform where ministries set out how their policies contribute to the implementation of the SDGs and the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development. Particular attention is paid to conflicting objectives and interactions with other targets at these meetings.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: When are the ministry reports published and who presents them?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Ministry reports are published after the meeting of the German Sustainability Strategy Council. Reports were presented by Ministers for Families, Senior Citizens, Interior, and Culture and Media, and the Commissioner for Culture and the Media for the years 2018 to December 2020.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the significance of publishing ministry reports and what is the history of flagship projects?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Publishing ministry reports helps strengthen the implementation of goals set in the international peer review and dialogue process. Since 2012, Germany's Development Strategy has selected a flagship project for sustainable development each year.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Which project was chosen as the flagship project for 2018 under the Global-local: locating the 2030 Agenda initiative?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The Municipalities for Global Sustainability project was selected as the flagship project for 2018, which is financed by the European Union and the United Nations Development Programme, and supports the implementation of the 2030 Agenda at the local level.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the goal of the flagship project and how does it support local authorities in implementing the 2030 Agenda?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The flagship project aims to help local governments implement the 2030 Agenda within their municipalities by providing methodical assistance in drawing up customised sustainability strategies. Local authorities also swap experiences with municipalities from the Global South to learn from each other.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What was the 2019 flagship project for the lightweighting strategy in Germany's industrial sector, and how was it developed?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The 2019 flagship project was the lightweighting strategy for Germany's industrial sector. It was developed through an interactive process with local authorities and relevant stakeholders, resulting in a key issues paper drawn up at three workshops from March 2019 to October 2020.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the role of the Social and Economic Council (SERC) in the Belgian context?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The Social and Economic Council (SERC) is an important institution in Belgian politics, playing a role where the social and political arenas meet. It was established by Parliament in 2004 and has since been reconstituted at the start of each legislative term. The SERC was previously incorporated into the lightweighting strategy of the Belgian government, but is no longer singled out as a specific project every year due to its widespread use in the creation and realization of projects.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What role does the Sustainability Committee play in the German Parliament, and what are some of its key responsibilities?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The Sustainability Committee is a body in the German Parliament responsible for promoting sustainability policies at national, European, and international levels. It has 17 ordinary and 17 deputy members, with significant representation from various parliamentary groups including the CDU/CSU, SPD, Greens, FDP, and AfD. The Committee brings sustainability issues into parliamentary work through political debates in parliamentary groups, committees, and plenary sessions. It holds regular public discussions on topics such as soil and water conservation, lifelong learning, follow-up to the SDG Summit, and sustainability through digitalization. The Committee also prepares statements and recommendations on priority areas of sustainability, attends meetings, invites the lead ministry to discussions, and examines sustainability impact assessments compiled

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the role of the relevant committee in the German Sustainable Development Strategy 2021 regarding the sustainability impact assessment of draft bills and regulations?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The relevant committee discusses and evaluates in writing the statement submitted by the entity conducting the sustainability impact assessment, ensuring transparency and prioritization of potentially conflicting objectives and alternatives.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What does the discussion paper of March 2020 propose for the German Sustainable Development Strategy 2021?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The paper calls for the development of an overarching strategy with consistent and coherent principles and targets, ensuring the greater visibility of sustainability as a central political challenge and its consideration at the international level.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What are some key concerns raised by the European level regarding policy coherence, legislation assessment, and stakeholder involvement?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The European level expresses concern for further improving policy coherence, refining the electronic sustainability assessment tool into a comprehensive legislation impact assessment, and involving social stakeholders. Suggestions are made for changes to the work of the European Commission and the communication of their meetings.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What recommendations did the Legislative Advisory Council on Sustainable Development make in its position paper published on 1 July 2020 to strengthen sustainability policy and assessment in Germany?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The Council advocated for a stronger sustainability policy, greater policy coherence, and the sustainability impact assessment. It called for an early assessment, publication, and review by a committee. Additionally, it recommended linking the federal budget with the SDGs.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How can the Parliamentary Advisory Council on Sustainable Development strengthen its role in the federal budget process?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The Council recommends an annual review of progress implementing sustainability policies, an annual debate during the "Sustainability and climate" plenary week, and upgrading its status to a permanent body, as well as additional resources and powers.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the purpose and frequency of the sustainability plenary week at the European Parliament, and when was the first one held?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The sustainability plenary week at the European Parliament is an annual event dedicated to debating the progress made in achieving national climate and sustainability targets. It was first held from 16 to 18 September 2020.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What action does the European Parliament call for regarding the implementation and achievement of the 17 sustainability targets of the EU?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The European Parliament calls on the European Commission to carry out a comprehensive review regarding the implementation and achievement of the EU's 17 sustainability targets by the middle of each subsequent legislative term.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the role and responsibilities of the German Sustainability Council (Nachhaltiger Rat)?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The German Sustainability Council (Nachhaltiger Rat) is a central stakeholder in sustainability policies in Germany. Its 15 members, appointed by the Federal Chancellor for three years, advise the German government on sustainable development, improve legislation, publish statements on specific issues, and raise public awareness and facilitate social dialogue surrounding sustainability. The council is professionally independent and receives support from the Federal Ministry for the Environment, Nature Conservation, Building and Nuclear Safety.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Who succeeded Dr. Marc-Thomas Aeschenbach as Secretary-General of the Sustainable Development Forum in February 2020?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Dr. Marc-Thomas Aeschenbach was succeeded by Prof. (Name not provided in context).

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the focus of the Sustainable Development Forum's initiatives mentioned in the 2016-2019 Activity Report?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The Sustainable Development Forum aims to launch implementation measures for sustainable development at all levels together with network partners through initiatives such as the Lord Mayor Dialogue, which calls for responsible leadership.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Who facilitates the "Sustainable Cities" dialogue between more than 30 Lord Mayors of German cities, and what is their role in promoting sustainable development in their cities?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The "Sustainable Cities" dialogue is facilitated by an organization since early 2010. The participating Lord Mayors, as political leaders, campaign for sustainable development in their cities and use the dialogue to discuss strategies and measures. They have also drawn up "Strategic cornerstones for sustainable development in municipalities" as the basis of their joint dialogue.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What commitments have the participating Lord Mayors made regarding sustainable development and climate neutrality?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The participating Lord Mayors have committed themselves to the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and the Sustainable Development Goals, as well as the sustainability targets defined for the German Sustainable Development Strategy 2021. They are also committed to the goal of climate neutrality and meeting the 1.5°C target of the Paris Agreement. These commitments form the strategic backbone of their common understanding of sustainable urban development.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the role of the cornerstones in promoting local government sustainability policy at the federal level and how do they achieve this?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The cornerstones form a regional network of 20 partners from all 16 Lander to support sustainable action and social transformation within the meaning of SDGs. They aim to network civil society activities with national, regional, and local authority sustainability strategies, and support stakeholders in contributing towards sustainable development in Germany by strengthening and networking their initiatives and competencies locally, regionally, and nationally.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Which organizations collaborate to present the awards for sustainable development goals, and how has the collaboration impacted the number of entries?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The four organizations - [name of the award], the [name of the partners], and [name of the award project] - have been collaborating since 2018 to present awards for sustainable development goals. This collaboration has resulted in around 450 entries, which is double the previous number. [Name of the award project] assists on the jury and provides support with its expertise and network.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What were some ways the  network raised awareness about global sustainability in 2019?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The network received funds for development policy educational work from a ment. They also secured prominent film spots at matches in 1. Bundesliga, published articles in magazine "db mobil," and participated in high-publicity events to raise awareness about global sustainability among people who had not previously shown interest in it.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the goal and duration of the regional sustainability network initiative, and who is providing the funding?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The regional sustainability network initiative, which aims to implement the 2030 Agenda at local and regional levels, is funded by the European Union to the tune of EUR 7.5 million over three years.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the German Sustainability Code and how does it support sustainability in various sectors?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The German Sustainability Code is an initiative that has been promoting sustainability in areas such as food culture, mobility, construction, fashion, and rural development through various projects. It has supported over 90 projects nationwide, including campaigns in schools and industry guideline compilations. Additionally, the Code provides companies and organizations with guidance for disclosing non-financial benefits and issues related to sustainability reporting. Over 600 companies use the Code's free database and services, and a nationwide training partner network of around 100 stakeholders assists in addressing new reporting requirements. Companies report on the basis of 20 sustainability criteria, creating a foundation for social dialogue on sustainable economic activity.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How is the transparency initiative of CSR Europe used, and where is it gaining popularity?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The transparency initiative of CSR Europe is used as a management tool for handling sustainability issues in companies, particularly in Europe, specifically in Greece, the Czech Republic, and Romania. It is also gaining relevance in connection with sustainable finance and the handling of sustainability risks. The lack of reliable and comparable corporate data is a concern in the discussion about a sustainable financial system.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What role does the Sustainability Code play for medium-sized companies and what are the plans for its development?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The Sustainability Code is used by medium-sized companies due to its practicability and to bring corporate practices into the political sphere. The Code is planned to be developed further in stakeholder dialogue over the next three years, with a focus on digitalisation and supply chain management. The report "Towards our Common Digital Future" will serve as a basis for this development. Sustainable development councils and similar multi-stakeholder platforms represent an important component of national sustainable development architectures and advise governments on options for action and social initiatives for sustainable development. Germany, Finland, and another country launched a Sustainability Council together during the SDG Summit in September 2019 to create a collective body of knowledge about implementing sustainability-related processes.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What role does the Council for Sustainable Development play in promoting sustainable development in the Basic Law, and what projects does it have planned for the future?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The Council for Sustainable Development supports the inclusion of sustainable development in the Basic Law through annual conferences and has received backing from international experts and the Chair of the Government on Sustainable Development. A future project for the Council is the Joint Effort for Sustainable Development initiative.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What did the European Commission say about the draft version of the German Sustainable Development Strategy on October 29, 2020?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The European Commission issued a statement recognizing the initial identification of areas of transformation in the draft version of the German Sustainable Development Strategy positively and emphasized the need for a fundamental transition rather than just readjustments in central policy areas.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What recommendations are made for the areas of transformation in German sustainability policy from the viewpoint of the author?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The author recommends supplementing areas of transformation with strategies and timetables, far-reaching and binding targets, focusing on off-track indicators, and compelling affected parties to adopt specific and effective countermeasures. They also suggest developing a new set of key indicators for German sustainability policy based on the areas of transformation.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Which organization is overseeing the German Sustainable Development Strategy and what is its role?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The German Sustainable Development Strategy is under the direct aegis of the Federal Ministry for the Environment, Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety (BMU). Despite this, the responsibilities for implementing the strategy and the 2030 Agenda remain with the respective ministries in their policy fields.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the role of Ministry Coordinators in ensuring the implementation of the 2030 Agenda in Germany?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Ministry Coordinators, nominated at each ministry (ideally at Director-General level), serve as the central contact person for sustainable development issues, are involved at interministerial level in implementing and promoting sustainability aspects in their ministry's policy and legislative process, and are published on the German Development Strategy website.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What steps have the ministries taken since the introduction of the Sustainability Strategy in 2017 to ensure political consistency in sustainability activities?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The ministries have adopted various measures such as the inclusion of a Coordinator function in their organizational charts, assignment of the Sustainability Officer to ministry management with direct access, attendance at regular high-level interministerial meetings, personnel support in the execution of tasks, and provision of in-house training on sustainability impact assessment issues and the contents of the Sustainability Strategy.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What replaced the original management rules in sustainability governance during the 2018 update?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The original management rules, consisting of three basic rules and nine rules of sustainability for specific action areas, were replaced by principles of sustainable development.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How can sustainable development be implemented as a guiding principle in all decisions?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The goal is to safeguard natural resources permanently, ensure social justice and equal participation, and synthesize economic efficiency with these goals. Decisions should take account of systemic interrelationships, technological innovations, and societal innovations to ensure environmentally and socially sustainable developments for present and future generations on a global scale.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What are the global responsibilities outlined in the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and the Paris Climate Agreement?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The global responsibilities outlined in the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and the Paris Climate Agreement include fighting against poverty, hunger, social inequality and exclusion, respecting, protecting and guaranteeing human rights, comprehensive participation for all in economic and social development, protection of the environment, especially the climate, and responsible government action under the rule of law.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is Germany's role in encouraging sustainable development in other countries?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Germany must consider and encourage sustainable development in other countries.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How can we strengthen the natural resource base while minimizing the impact on other countries and the environment?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: By closing material cycles as quickly as possible, using renewable natural goods within their regenerative capacity, and using non-renewable natural goods sparingly.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How can social cohesion be strengthened in an open society according to the UN's sustainable development goals?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: To strengthen social cohesion, poverty and social exclusion should be overcome and prevented, equivalent living standards should be achieved in every region, everyone should have an equal opportunity to share in economic growth, necessary adaptations to demographic change should be made early on, everyone should be able to participate fully in social, cultural and political life without discrimination, and contributions should be made to reduce poverty and inequality worldwide.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How many indicators and targets are there in Germany's Development Strategy for Sustainable Development, and how have they been aligned and updated?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The Strategy contains 75 indicators and targets in 41 areas. They have been brought into line with the 17 SDGs and given a more international outlook in the new version published at the start of 2017.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What were the new additions to the 2030 agenda and what do they represent?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Thirteen new topic areas and 30 indicators were added, representing issues of particular relevance to Germany's implementation of the 2030 agenda. Some of these indicators serve as gateways to more comprehensive indicator systems and statistics, such as poverty and inequality, biodiversity, and crime statistics.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What role does the Federal Statistical Office play in monitoring Germany's sustainability strategy and reporting on national sustainability indicators?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The Federal Statistical Office reports extensively on the trend in national sustainability indicators every two years, providing insight into various social groups, economic sectors, and geographical areas in Germany. It identifies relevant needs for action in these areas through at least one indicator-backed political target for each.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How is the achievement of targets in this remit scored, and where can the related data be accessed?

This platform offers added value through interactive functions such as individual feature selection, download of figures and data, and a map-based illustration of the indicators. The data for Germany concerning the Sustainable Development Goals of the United Nations 2030 can be found in a linked domain of the online platform.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What role does the German Statistics Office play in publishing and coordinating global indicators, and how are these indicators linked with the German Sustainable Development Strategy?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The German Statistics Office publishes and coordinates annual data on global indicators, primarily based on official statistical data and other sources. These indicators are linked with the German Sustainable Development Strategy as it is the national implementation of the 2030 Agenda. The site provides a clear overview of the links between the German strategy and reporting systems at European and global levels. Different indicators are needed at various reporting levels due to spatial resolution or international topic importance.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Which indicators pose a challenge in terms of data availability for measuring SDG progress and shaping sustainable policies?

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Why is the target and indicator system important in the Strategy, despite not being the only instrument for assessment?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The target and indicator system is important in the Strategy as it helps structure public services in a needs-based manner and takes account of social aspects, even though not all relevant areas for sustainable development or measures can be shown within the system.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What role do the Preamble of the 2030 Agenda, principles of sustainable development, and insights from diverse participation processes play in the German Sustainable Development Strategy 2021?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: They serve as a guide along with the targets and measures set out in the Strategy for the political debate on sustainable development.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the significance of the targets and measures in the German Sustainable Development Strategy 2021?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: They determine the level of ambition for sustainable development and the associated political debate.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the focus of discussions regarding the German Sustainable Development Strategy 2021?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Discussions frequently revolve around the indicators, but the targets and measures are ultimately more important for the political debate.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Why is the number of sustainability indicators in the Strategy deliberately limited?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The number of sustainability indicators is limited to facilitate an overview of sustainable development with minimal data, create a manageable sustainability policy compass, and ensure sensible additions/adjustments and comprehensive mapping of important policy areas.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How can public finances be used as a lever for sustainable development?

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Linking sustainability targets with the federal budget through an initial model project could put fiscal and budgetary policy leverage to better effect, promote sustainable development, and create more clarity about which budgetary measures contribute to achieving the sustainability targets.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How does the new version of the regulatory impact assessment improve the sustainability impact assessment, and what tool is used for this purpose?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The new version of the regulatory impact assessment includes an improved sustainability impact assessment, which is conducted using a computer-assisted tool called eNAP. The assessment is framed by the targets and indicators of the EU Sustainable Development Strategy and the Principles for Sustainable Development, as well as other references to the individual SDGs. eNAP is intended to improve assessment quality and make it easier to perform.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: When was eNAP launched, and who can use it?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: eNAP was launched on 1 March 2018 and is available to all social stakeholders.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the future application for sustainability impact assessments, and to whom is it applicable?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The web-based electronic sustainability impact assessment will be applied to all regulatory initiatives in the future.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Who is responsible for conducting sustainability impact assessments and how are they used?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The sustainability impact assessments are the responsibility of the (Germany's Development Strategy for Sustainable the SDGs and the targets and indicators of the federal budget), and they are used by the relevant lead committees in their own reviews, as well as in subsequent court rulings as part of the historic interpretation of standards.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How can the connection between targets, indicators, and budgetary policy measures improve the impact orientation of the federal budget?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The creation of transparency concerning the connection between targets and indicators and budgetary policy measures can help improve the impact orientation of the federal budget, make conflicts between different sustainability targets more easily recognizable, and contribute to the gradual improvement of the quantification of the impact of sustainability programs, enhancing the quality of public finances as a whole.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is expected of financial market participants regarding addressing risks within their investment strategy, according to Green Bonds?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Green Bonds expects all financial market participants to address risks within the framework of their investment strategy.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What signals has the government sent regarding sustainability and transparency in financial markets by issuing green federal securities?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The government has signaled its commitment to sustainability and transparency in financial markets by successfully issuing a ten-year green bond and a five-year green bond with a total volume of 11.5 billion in the second half of 2020. The performance audit for the issue of these bonds was also concluded positively. Additionally, these securities include considerations for risks arising from sustainability aspects to avoid potential "stranded" assets.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the role of the sustainability training office at in providing continuing education for managers and staff of the federal administration?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The sustainability training office at is responsible for developing needs-based continuing education and support measures for managers and staff of the federal administration to help them manage the transformation processes towards sustainable development.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How is the German Government encouraging federal authorities to become climate-neutral by 2030, and what training methods are being used to facilitate this transition?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The German Government aims to have all federal authorities operating in a climate-neutral manner by 2030. To achieve this, many authorities see a need for new expertise and instruments. There is a strong demand for technical presentations, specialist and organizational knowledge, best practice examples, and an exchange of experiences. Proven training formats include workshops, coaching, and conferences, while new online formats are also being well-received.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Which organizations is the sustainability training office collaborating with to develop optimal further training opportunities for employees of authorities?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The sustainability training office is collaborating with partners such as GIZ, BMU, Federal Office for Civil Protection and Nuclear Safety, Federal Environment Agency, Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy, and universities and other social partners.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the importance of communicating progress in implementing the 2030 Agenda in German sustainability policy?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Communicating progress in implementing the 2030 Agenda is one of the primary elements of German sustainability policy and holds great importance in public relations work for the government and individual ministries.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What recommendation was given in the 2018 peer review evaluation of Germany regarding providing more information about the 2030 Agenda and its implementation?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The international experts encouraged Germany to provide more information about the implementation of the 2030 Agenda and their progress towards achieving its targets through the Voluntary National Review (VNR).

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Why is it important to communicate the sustainability story effectively?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Effectively communicating the sustainability story, including the targets and the global narrative, is important despite the complexity of achieving the targets.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How can effective communication contribute to implementing the German Sustainable Development Strategy?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Effective communication can make people curious and awaken their interest in sustainability, sparking a genuine commitment to promote Germany's sustainability efforts. It is necessary to improve and expand communication structures at all levels and in all sectors to make a major contribution to implementing the German Sustainable Development Strategy.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How much budget was allocated for interministerial sustainability communication in the 2018 and following years?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: EUR 600,000 in 2018 and EUR 1 million per year starting from 2019.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the goal of the communication strategy in the context of the ministries' public and press relations work?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The goal of the communication strategy is to make the population aware of what the ministries are doing, help them understand and adapt to the necessary transformation process towards a sustainable economy and consumption, and achieve this through interministerial communication.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What are the key features of the digital information campaign for the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) by the European Union?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The campaign utilizes participatory elements, directly approaches the public, involves multipliers and civil society, and is almost entirely digital. It targets 18-30-year-olds and aims to awaken curiosity about the SDGs using seventeen unusual figures.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How did's digital and social media campaign contribute to the increase in awareness of the 2030 Agenda and SDGs?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The campaign, which featured motivating best practice videos and interactive elements on's website, led to a significant increase in awareness of the 2030 Agenda. Before the campaign, only a quarter of the population was aware of it, but this rose to more than a third after the campaign. Current studies suggest that while many people consider sustainability important, there is still a need for more information.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What were the findings of the two surveys regarding the awareness and importance of the SDGs and sustainability among the German population?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The first survey conducted from September 2018 to June 2019 among 26,374 persons in Germany showed that fewer than half of the respondents were aware of the SDGs. The climate protection measures, health and well-being, and high-quality education goals were considered particularly important. In July 2020, a representative survey revealed that sustainability was the second most important issue after climate protection. The digital information campaign of the German government was supplemented and strengthened by additional initiatives launched in November 2019 and by links.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What are some ways that the eral campaign promotes the 2030 Agenda at regional events and engages specific target groups?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The eral campaign brings together stakeholders from politics, business, and society for regional events to promote the 2030 Agenda. Online initiatives, such as a participation portal supported by the Federal Ministry for the Environment, Nature Conservation, and Nuclear Safety, and a website with information about local government progress in implementing the SDGs, address specific target groups. Social media provides consumer-oriented information and guidance on key sustainability issues. The high-profile participation of the public, associations, and the professional public in updating the German Sustainable Development Strategy is also an important strategic communication approach.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What are some notable elements of the communication strategy for the German Sustainability Strategy update, as mentioned in the context?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The communication strategy includes high-profile support from the German Sustainability Award, peer review as an example of best practice, and support from various federal ministries ( and ) and the Federal Government's Information Office. The strategy update went through four nationwide public dialogues and a public consultation in October 2020.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What are the key factors for effective sustainability communication according to the meeting?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The credibility of the communicator, major efforts in areas like climate action and gender equality, fact-based communication during crises, and a balance between abstract concepts and specific examples.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: According to the survey, how strongly are people interested in the topics of European policy, refugees and asylum, pension policy, German presidency of the EU, and digitalization?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The survey results indicate the following levels of interest: European policy (36), refugees and asylum (36), pension policy (37), German presidency of the EU (37), and digitalization (44).

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What are the 11 areas of action in the Programme of Measures for Sustainability of the German Federal Administration?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The 11 areas of action in the Programme of Measures for Sustainability of the German Federal Administration are: sustainable construction, climate action, use of renewable energies, energy-efficient modernisation plan, energy/environmental management systems, public procurement, sustainability criteria for cafeteria services, reduction and offsetting of CO2 emissions caused by transport, event organisation, compatibility of work with family life/care, and cultural diversification within the administration.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What were some key developments regarding the climate package in the autumn of 2019, including target years and government units set up?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The eral administration set a target year of 2030 for becoming climate-neutral. A eral Government Coordination Unit was established to support this work. The ministries of Development and of Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety had already started setting their administrations on a climate-neutral path in 2019 and 2020, respectively. CO2 emissions are calculated as part of the European Union Emissions Trading System (ETS) and the European Union Emissions Trading Scheme for the Land Use, Land Use Change and Forestry sector (LULUCF).

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How is the Federation-Lander cooperation being strengthened to address sustainable public procurement challenges?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The goal is to strengthen the Federation-Lander cooperation on sustainable public procurement by building on the programme of measures and the role of the Centre of Excellence for Sustainable Procurement (KNB).

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How is the cooperation important for sustainable procurement, and what steps are being taken to promote it?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The cooperation is important for making use of the economic policy opportunities of sustainable procurement. Steps being taken to promote it include setting priorities for structuring procurement processes and operating conditions, equipping staff with necessary skills, and increasing use of budgetary control opportunities in favor of sustainable public procurement.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What administrative statistics have been published on public tenders awarded at different levels?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The Office, on behalf of fairs and markets, has published administrative statistics on public tenders awarded at federal, Land, and local authority level.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What changes were made to the German Procurement Statistics Act in March 2020, and how did it impact the recording of sustainability criteria in tender award procedures?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The German Procurement Statistics Act was amended in March 2020 with the Act to Accelerate Procurement in Defence and Security and (Gesetz zur beschleunigten Beschaffung im Verteidigungsbereich und zur Optimierung der Vergabestatistik). This amendment considerably extended the recording of sustainability criteria in tender award procedures, particularly in those above the upper threshold, allowing for the identification of which stage of the procurement process included specific sustainability criteria.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: When did the new version of Germany's Development Strategy for Sustainability take effect, and what was the date that sustainability criteria were introduced for procurement processes in the lower threshold area?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The new version of Germany's Development Strategy for Sustainability took effect in May 2020, while sustainability criteria were introduced for procurement processes in the lower threshold area on 1 October 2020.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the new obligation for procurers regarding energy efficiency in the European market according to the updated version of a certain regulation?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Procurers must prescribe the highest energy efficiency class available on the European market or the highest performance level when setting out product specifications.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What role does the German Sustainability Award (Deutscher Nachhaltigkeitspreis) play in promoting sustainable textile procurement in the German government?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The German Sustainability Award has pioneered the first-time integrated definition of social and environmental criteria for specific textile products in the German Government's guideline. It offers practical support to procurement officers in applying stringent sustainability criteria during the procurement process. Since 2012, the Award has been supporting contracting authorities in the federal, state, and local governments in taking account of sustainability criteria in their procurements.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What are some ways that can be contacted for sustainable procurement, and what services do they offer?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: They can be contacted via telephone hotline and e-mail for sustainable procurement. offers training on sustainable procurement and human rights in procurement. They operate a central information platform on sustainable public procurement with legal frameworks, guidelines, and more. They work with all areas of society to promote sustainable public procurement and have negotiated a declaration of commitment with industry organization Bitkom for the inclusion of social criteria in IT procurement. is being expanded and further developed as the central point of contact and advice center of.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What are the key components of expanding services for strategic procurement management, and how are they related to digital transformation?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The expansion of services for strategic procurement management involves networking all parties involved, such as clients and budget planners. Cooperation with external organizations, like the German Federal Institute for Materials Research and Testing (BAM) and advisory services, is to be improved. In light of digital transformation, alternative support formats are to be promoted. The federal administration aims to develop these measures in an ambitious manner, beyond climate neutrality and sustainable procurement, and apply them as widely as possible.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Which Lander in Germany have drawn up or are currently working on their sustainable development strategies?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Baden-Wurttemberg, Bavaria, Brandenburg, Hesse, Lower Saxony, North Rhine-Westphalia, Rhineland-Palatinate, Saarland, Saxony, and Thuringia.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What was the focus of the meetings prepared and led by the Conference of Minister-Presidents in 2018/2019, and how often do the Head of States discuss shared sustainability issues?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The focus of the meetings was on aligning the sustainability structures of Brandenburg and Thuringia to reach the goals of the 2030 Agenda. The Head of States discuss shared sustainability issues regularly at meetings between them.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What did the German government urge all EU members to do regarding sustainable development and the 2030 Agenda?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The German government urged all EU members to develop sustainable development strategies and align them more closely to the EU's sustainable development goals, while also being able to set their own priorities in the interests of federalism. They stressed the need for ambitious joint activities to implement the Global Sustainable Development Goals and called for a set of joint indicators based on a report on the status of cooperation.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What are the German Sustainable Development Strategy indicators proposed to serve as the basis for EU and national sustainable development strategies?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The German Sustainable Development Strategy indicators, outlined in the report, are proposed to be the basis for EU and national sustainable development strategies. These indicators will be incorporated into the sustainable development strategies of other EU countries, as long as it makes sense in light of their individual approaches and methods. The Heads of the German, European, and French Statistical Offices, as well as the German Sustainable Development Exchange, have been asked to continue working on a set of joint indicators.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the title and date of the joint declaration issued by the Federal Chancellor and the Lander regarding sustainable development?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The title of the joint declaration is "Working together to promote sustainable development - assuming responsibility for a bright future in Germany, Europe and around the world". It was issued on 6 June 2019.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What are the three sections of the joint declaration on sustainable development?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The joint declaration on sustainable development consists of three sections.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Which Lander were invited to participate in updating the Sustainable Development Strategy according to the resolution of 9 May 2019?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The Lander of Baden-Württemberg, Schleswig-Holstein, and North Rhine-Westphalia were invited to participate in updating the Sustainable Development Strategy.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What was agreed upon in the resolution of 12 November 2020 regarding the implementation of the 2030 Agenda and the SDGs by Germany and its Lander?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Germany and its Lander agreed to increase efforts at all levels and in all sectors of society to achieve the SDGs and reiterated their commitment to the ongoing procedure for the Joint Effort for climate-neutral administration. They also asked for clarification on the next steps for exchange between the federal government and the Lander on sustainable procurement and climate-neutral administration.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is a central tool for supporting global responsibility at Lander level?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: A programme is a central tool for supporting global responsibility at Lander level.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How does the German Sustainable Development Strategy promote the engagement of German Lander with development policy?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The German Sustainable Development Strategy promotes the engagement of German Lander with development policy by enabling the federal, state, and local authority levels to be linked through a cooperation framework. Almost all Lander are active with projects in the Global South through this framework, and there is a formalized exchange between the EU and Lander on development issues. The four key areas (four German states) have facilitated this linkage. The goal is to implement the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development of the UN with its 17 Sustainable Development Goals in Germany.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the goal of adopting the 2030 Agenda and how does Germany plan to contribute?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The goal of adopting the 2030 Agenda is to preserve the Earth's natural basis for life in the long term and enable all people to live in dignity. Germany plans to contribute by raising the profile and harnessing the potential of sustainable development at the national and international level through sustainable innovations and investments, thereby creating and safeguarding employment in the long term.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the focus of the resolution for Germany's Development Strategy as stated in the Chancellor's speech in Berlin on June 6, 2019?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The resolution emphasizes the importance of winning people over for the cause of sustainable development, strengthening cohesion and participation, and making the necessary processes of change a priority for everyone.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What are the priorities for shaping a sustainable future at the global, European Union, and German levels?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: At the global level, preserving achievements of multilateralism and strengthening sustainable development is a priority. In the European Union, shaping the future together in the spirit of sustainable development through cooperation between the newly elected Commission, member states, and a new Parliament is the focus. In Germany, gearing efforts more strongly towards sustainable development is the priority.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How can Germany achieve sustainable development?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Sustainable development in Germany can be achieved through collaborative efforts from the public, local authorities, companies, initiatives, and organizations, with each contributing based on their interests, opportunities, talents, and skills.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How can local government contribute to achieving the targets of the 2030 Agenda and the German Sustainable Development Strategy?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Local government plays a crucial role in achieving the goals of the 2030 Agenda and the German Sustainable Development Strategy.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How can sustainable development be implemented locally, and what is the role of each level of government in achieving the goals of the 2030 Agenda?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: In a multi-level federal system, each level of government - national, regional, and local - bears a joint responsibility for achieving the goals of the 2030 Agenda. An important role is played by local government and municipal umbrella organizations in implementing sustainable development at the local level.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What initiative was launched in 2017 by German municipal umbrella organizations, DVG, BDL, and Engagement Global's Service Agency Communities in One World, to highlight the contribution of local governments to the 2030 Agenda?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The SDG indicators for local authorities project was launched.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What was the focus of the second edition of the "SDG indicators for local authorities" handbook, published in 2020?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The second edition of the "SDG indicators for local authorities" handbook, published in 2020, placed a greater focus on SDG 3 (health) in response to the pandemic.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Which website can municipalities access to retrieve freely available healthcare indicators for creating sustainability reports?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The website for retrieving freely available healthcare indicators for municipalities is www.sdg-portal.de.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How can municipalities with more than 5,000 inhabitants use the available healthcare indicators?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Municipalities with more than 5,000 inhabitants can compile sustainability reports using the available healthcare indicators with little outlay.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the role of other municipalities in using the healthcare indicators?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Other municipalities use the healthcare indicators as an opening balance sheet and change, replace, or supplement indicators according to their local authority policy priorities.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Why did the SDG Portal win an award in 2019, and in which categories was it nominated?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The SDG Portal won an award in seven different categories at the SDG Awards in 2019, including being nominated in the "Best visualization" category and singled out as one of three projects in the final. The easy operation and attractive visualization of the portal were decisive factors in its win. The award helped draw attention to the project among local governments throughout the world.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Which international organizations and local governments are promoting the use of the Italian portal for sustainable development practices and contributing to its expansion?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The Italian portal is being promoted by various international organizations within the framework of the High-level Political Forum (HLPF), as well as local governments such as Mannheim, Bonn, and Stuttgart in Germany. The application of the method to Moroccan municipalities is also in preparation, and communication with local authorities largely takes place at the level of the Lander.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How is Engagement Global and its Service Agency One World supporting municipalities in implementing the 2030 Agenda and Sustainability Strategies?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Engagement Global and its Service Agency One World advise municipalities on the development of sustainability strategies under the aspect of municipal development policy, as part of the "Municipalities for Global Sustainability" initiative in Baden-Württemberg, Bavaria, Brandenburg, Lower Saxony, North Rhine-Westphalia, Saarland, Schleswig-Holstein, and Thuringia.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: Which project does the European Union (EU) consider as a flagship initiative for sustainable municipal development in relation to the 2030 Agenda?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The "Global-local: locating the 2030 Agenda" project.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: How do local authorities contribute to this project, and what role do they play in achieving the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) at the local level?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: They contribute through their representation on the individual project advisory boards, which can be facilitated by the EU and/or relevant specialist ministries.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What international recognition has the project received, and how is it being discussed at the local level?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: The project has been cited in the reflection paper "Towards a Sustainable Europe by 2030" as a policy highlight. It is recognized internationally within the "A territorial approach to the SDGs" of the European Union and the "Local SDG Leadership Initiative" of the Brookings Institution. Over 30 lord mayors are discussing their sustainability initiatives as part of the Lord Mayor Initiative.

2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.question: What is the role of social stakeholders in the German Sustainable Development Strategy and the 2030 Agenda, and how is their involvement facilitated?
2021-07-26-gsds-en-data_removed.pdf.answer: Social stakeholders, including civil society, business, science, churches, and local government, are involved in the German Sustainable Development Strategy and the 2030 Agenda through annual dialogues held at the Federal Chancellery.
